page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: The area is mainly residential. The type of housing is mixed. Part of the area is council housing built in the 1930's to take overspill population from the inner City redevlopment. The houses are a mixture of semi-detached, detached and terraced blocks. All are made of red brick with tiled roofs and small porches. None have garages. They are built in tree-lined crescents with many cul-de-sacs. There are large detached and semi-detached homes of indvidual styles and sizes. There are Victorian terraces and villa-type houses, (two or three storeys) with small front gardens or none at all and narrow back gardens. The Lyndhurst Estate contains houses built in the 1950's with separate blocks of garages. There are also 12-storey blocks of flats which have been reinforced.
